sentence.Network_en: After his education, Goldschmidt became a pupil of the composer Franz Schreker.
sentence.Network_cn: 学业结束后，戈尔德施米特成了作曲家弗朗兹·施雷克尔的学生。

sentence.Network_en: Lewis emerges as a composer of distinction and sensitivity.
sentence.Network_cn: 刘易斯作为一位悟性很高的优秀作曲家崭露头角。

sentence.Network_en: As a professional composer I owe much to Radio 3.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一名职业作曲家，我十分感激第三电台。

entry.def: A composer is a person who writes music, especially classical music.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who composes music as a profession

means.word_mean: (尤指古典音乐)作曲家,创作者,作曲者

sentences.en: The composer expresses his sorrow in his music.
sentences.cn: 这位作曲家用音乐表达他的悲伤。

sentences.en: The composer set a sonnet to music.
sentences.cn: 作曲家为一首十四行诗谱了曲。

sentences.en: The composer’s works will always live on.
sentences.cn: 这位作曲家的作品将永远留在人间。
